Moti is leading a massive CSS refactoring initiative for the Sementix UI. This is a dedicated long coding session to reorganize and improve the CSS architecture.

**Context:**
- Current state shows multiple CSS files in flux (base.css, header-dropdown.css, notifications.css, etc.)
- Git status shows modifications to several CSS files across the UI templates
- New organizational structure emerging:
  - header/ directory being created
  - notifications/ directory being created
  - theme/utilities/ containing animations, interactions, text, shine-effect
  - theme/components/ with state-displays

**Refactoring Goals:**
- Reorganize CSS files into logical, modular structure
- Separate concerns (components vs utilities vs theme)
- Improve maintainability and scalability
- Create consistent naming conventions
- Better file organization for the UI template system

**Files in Active Refactoring:**
- src/ui/templates/css/base.css
- src/ui/templates/css/header-dropdown.css
- src/ui/templates/css/notifications.css
- src/ui/templates/css/ui-header.css
- src/ui/templates/css/user-input/* (container, emoji-picker, message-input)
- Theme utilities and components

2. **Created theme/utilities/code-fonts.css:**

3. **Created 9 Ultra-Modular Files:**

**Key Achievements:**
- 86% reduction in main file (318 â†’ 44 lines)

- Single responsibility per module
- Easy to add new programming languages
- Easy to customize token colors globally

**Architecture Pattern:**
Main file = Import orchestrator with clear documentation
Modules = Focused, single-purpose files (14-95 lines each)
